content: * *This article has multiple issues.** Please help **improve it** or discuss these issues on the **talk page**. *(Learn how and when to remove these messages)*This article **relies excessively on references to primary sources**. Please improve this article by adding secondary or tertiary sources. *Find sources:* "E!" Asian TV channel – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(April 2019)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "E!" Asian TV channel – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(August 2023)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*Television channel **E!** was a Singaporean version of the American TV channel [E!](/wiki/E!) which owned the [American channel of the same name](/wiki/E!) in [Hollywood](/wiki/Hollywood,_Los_Angeles), [Los Angeles](/wiki/Los_Angeles) as [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) [24-hour](/wiki/24-hour_clock) [English](/wiki/Singapore_English) [entertainment](/wiki/Entertainment) [pay television channel](/wiki/Pay_television) was officially full formal launched on 3 May 1995 as a [24-hour](/wiki/24-hour_clock) [pay television channel](/wiki/Pay_television). It is owned by [NBCUniversal International Networks](/wiki/NBCUniversal_International_Networks) under Television Corporation of Singapore (TCS) to viewers across [Southeast Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia) and [ASEAN](/wiki/ASEAN). This channel officially slogan, motto, jargon and tagline is **Be Pop Cultured**. It operated from [Marina Bay Sands](/wiki/Marina_Bay_Sands) head office and headquarters in [Marina Bay Sands](/wiki/Marina_Bay_Sands), 10 Bayfront Avenue, [Marina Bay](/wiki/Marina_Bay,_Singapore), [Downtown Core](/wiki/Downtown_Core), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). ## History E! Entertainment Television was officially launched on 3 May 1995 as [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) [24-hour](/wiki/24-hour_clock) [English](/wiki/Singapore_English) [pay television channel](/wiki/Pay_television), owned by Television Corporation of Singapore (TCS) under license from [Time Warner Communications](/wiki/WarnerMedia). It was broadcast from [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), airing throughout [Southeast Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia), including [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia) and [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It operated from Television Corporation of Singapore (TCS) head office and headquarters in [Caldecott Broadcast Centre](/wiki/Caldecott_Hill), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). E! Entertainment Television was officially launched at stroke of midnight [Singapore Time](/wiki/Singapore_Time) with an opening ceremony by [Tyra Banks](/wiki/Tyra_Banks) being a simulcast from [Hallmark Entertainment Network](/wiki/Diva_(Asian_TV_channel)). E! Asia was also an Asian version of the American TV channel [E! Entertainment](/wiki/E!) which was owned by Television Corporation of Singapore (TCS) under license from [Time Warner Communications](/wiki/WarnerMedia). E!'s launch was celebrated on air from iconic locations; the [Padang, Singapore](/wiki/Padang,_Singapore) and [Changi Airport](/wiki/Changi_Airport). E! Asia's production facilities were located in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). Among the popular reality shows included [Kim Kardashian](/wiki/Kim_Kardashian), [Khloé Kardashian](/wiki/Khlo%C3%A9_Kardashian) and [Kourtney Kardashian](/wiki/Kourtney_Kardashian)'s [Keeping Up with the Kardashians](/wiki/Keeping_Up_with_the_Kardashians). On 23 June 2010, E! Entertainment Television and [Hallmark Channel](/wiki/Diva_(Asian_TV_channel)) operations including its after new relocation its new broadcast studio, new production office, new telecast transmitter, new satellite telecast station, new media city, new telecast city, new media complex to shared with [Marina Bay Sands](/wiki/Marina_Bay_Sands) head office and headquarters in [Marina Bay Sands](/wiki/Marina_Bay_Sands), 10 Bayfront Avenue, [Marina Bay](/wiki/Marina_Bay,_Singapore), [Downtown Core](/wiki/Downtown_Core), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) during officially opening ceremony of [Marina Bay Sands](/wiki/Marina_Bay_Sands). On 28 January 2015 after one week of rebranding/rebrand of [Singtel](/wiki/Singtel) took place, the [HD](/wiki/High-definition_television) version of E! Entertainment Television was officially known, and called as **E! Entertainment HD** was officially formal full grand opened and launched "ON AIR" took place on [Singtel TV](/wiki/Singtel_TV) [digital](/wiki/Digital_television) [digital high-definition (HDTV)](/wiki/High-definition_television) [Internet protocol broadband](/wiki/Internet_Protocol_television) [television](/wiki/Streaming_television) on Channel HD328 uses the [HD](/wiki/High-definition_television) [1080i60](/wiki/1080i) image format with a 16:9 aspect ratio and [Dolby Atmos](/wiki/Dolby_Atmos) sound format. ### Closing Night At stroke of midnight on [New Year's Day](/wiki/New_Year%27s_Day) (/wiki/2020_in_Singapore), E! Entertainment Television officially ceased broadcasting and transmission by [Kourtney Kardashian](/wiki/Kourtney_Kardashian), [Kim Kardashian](/wiki/Kim_Kardashian), [Kendall Jenner](/wiki/Kendall_Jenner), [Kylie Jenner](/wiki/Kylie_Jenner), and [Khloé Kardashian](/wiki/Khlo%C3%A9_Kardashian) after officially very final and last shutdown sequence commenced during the very final and last programme being *[Keeping Up with the Kardashians](/wiki/Keeping_Up_with_the_Kardashians)* with very final and last season (as of Season 17) and final and last episode (as of Episode 252 and Season Episode 12) title as "Cattle Drive Me Crazy" the end before going off-the-air. Post closure of the channel, E! Entertainment Television officially merged into **[FOX Life Asia](/wiki/Fox_Life)** (after the [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong), [ASEAN](/wiki/ASEAN), and [Southeast Asian](/wiki/Southeast_Asia) version of [Star World](/wiki/Star_World) was officially formal full grand introducing, launching, opening, inaugurating, restructuring, reorganised, and rebranded to **[FOX Life Asia](/wiki/Fox_Life)** on 1 October 2017 at 9:00:00am [Singapore Time](/wiki/Singapore_Time)), and all television programmes officially moved from E! Entertainment Television after officially ceased transmission to **[FOX Life Asia](/wiki/Fox_Life)** (after the [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong), [ASEAN](/wiki/ASEAN), and [Southeast Asian](/wiki/Southeast_Asia) version of [Star World](/wiki/Star_World) was officially formal full grand introducing, launching, opening, inaugurating, restructuring, reorganised, and rebranded to **[FOX Life Asia](/wiki/Fox_Life)** on 1 October 2017 at 9:00:00am [Singapore Time](/wiki/Singapore_Time)). Post officially closure of E! Entertainment Television was officially relocated, and replalced by the [HD](/wiki/High-definition_television) version of [STAR World Asia](/wiki/Star_World) (now [FOX Life Asia](/wiki/Fox_Life)) was officially known, and called as **[STAR World Asia HD](/wiki/Star_World) (now [FOX Life Asia HD](/wiki/Fox_Life))** was officially formal full grand opened and launched "ON AIR" took place on 16 October 2013 by [Singtel TV](/wiki/Singtel_TV) [digital](/wiki/Digital_television) [digital high-definition (HDTV)](/wiki/High-definition_television) [Internet protocol broadband](/wiki/Internet_Protocol_television) [television](/wiki/Streaming_television) on Channel HD301 uses the [HD](/wiki/High-definition_television) [1080i60](/wiki/1080i) image format with a 16:9 aspect ratio and [Dolby Atmos](/wiki/Dolby_Atmos) sound format. ## Former original programming In December 2014, the channel launched its first local [Malaysian](/wiki/Malaysia) [miniseries](/wiki/Miniseries) *Facing Up to [Fazura](/wiki/Fazura)*. E! Asia also produced *E! News Asia Specials*, focusing profiles of national celebrities such as [Aaron Aziz](/wiki/Aaron_Aziz), [Anne Curtis](/wiki/Anne_Curtis), [Jay Park](/wiki/Jay_Park), and [Lisa Surihani](/wiki/Lisa_Surihani). ## Final programming - [Keeping Up with the Kardashians](/wiki/Keeping_Up_with_the_Kardashians) - [Revenge Body with Khloé Kardashian](/wiki/Revenge_Body_with_Khlo%C3%A9_Kardashian)
title: E! (Asian TV channel)
